name: Spaghetti with Meaty Sauce and Grilled Zucchini
description: Classic spaghetti with a rich meat sauce and a side of fresh grilled zucchini.

ingredients.name: Olive oil
ingredients.notes: Divided: 3/4 tsp for sauce, 1 1/2 tsp for zucchini

ingredients.name: Salt
ingredients.notes: Divided: 1/4 tsp for sauce, 1/8 tsp for zucchini

instructions: Meaty Sauce: Heat 3/4 tsp olive oil in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Cook onion until soft, ~3 minutes.
Meaty Sauce: Add garlic, cook 30 seconds.
Meaty Sauce: Add beef, cook until browned, ~5 minutes, drain excess fat if desired.
Meaty Sauce: Stir in tomato paste, cook 1 minute.
Meaty Sauce: Add red wine (if using), simmer 1 minute.
Meaty Sauce: Add crushed tomatoes, oregano, basil, red pepper flakes, sugar, 1/4 tsp salt, and 1/8 tsp pepper. Simmer on low, covered, ~20 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Spaghetti: Boil salted water in a pot. Cook spaghetti until al dente, ~8 minutes. Drain, toss with a drizzle of olive oil.
Grilled Zucchini: Heat a grill pan or skillet over medium-high.
Grilled Zucchini: Toss sliced zucchini with 1 1/2 tsp olive oil, garlic powder, thyme, 1/8 tsp salt, and pinch black pepper.
Grilled Zucchini: Grill ~2 minutes per side until charred and tender. Drizzle with lemon juice.
Assemble: Plate ~1 1/2 cups cooked spaghetti. Top with ~1 cup sauce. Add ~1 cup zucchini on the side.
cookNotes: Storage: Refrigerate in an airtight container for up to 4 days or freeze for 3 months.
Reheating: Microwave 1-2 minutes, stirring halfway, or heat in a skillet with a splash of water.
